Good morning. We will be having out last rallies in Karamoja sub region today. I have been warmly received here and I thank you.
Yesterday while with the people of Kotido, I asked them to keep hope alive. And through hope we would have change.
Kotido and Karamoja in particular remains an underdeveloped area. Not enough has been done or perhaps the wrong intervention.
Education shall be a priority for the area under the #GoForward government. Education for girls is very important.
One of the changes under my government shall be in ownership of land. This is a big problem in the area.
Land and minerals of Karamoja have to be protected for this generation and generations to come. Karamoja shall have special consideration.
I don't agree with those who say they are waiting for Karamoja to develop. Special attention has to be taken to allow this development.
This development must take into consideration the views and attitudes of Karamoja.
Finally to achieve all of this in Karamoja we need peace and a government that is at peace with its citizens.
Thank you the people of Kanawat for coming to hear our message.

I would like to thank you heartily for such a warm welcome. The name Ariong was given to me yesterday - Napak. https://t.co/8QtrgxC07K
This name Ariong was given to me yesterday as the Tepeth adopted me into their tribe. It means "son of a chief". https://t.co/G0D6XlzIAR
I'm aware many here have been intimidated not to attend our rally but you came anyway.You being here means a rejection of that intimidation.
Some of you may be asking why I am standing? Why after thirty years in various government positions. What can I provide that is different?
First of all, these years in service have given me experience in how government works.
If you want to bring change you must understand they system so that you can spot where the weaknesses are. I have been here since 1986.
The way the constitution is set up, all power is vested in the President. Not even the Vice President has powers unless they are given.
The Head of State is the ultimate leader. the decision maker. Part of building an effective government is building trust among the people.
Part of building an effective government is building trust among the people that government shall continue efficiently after you are gone.
A transition that will allow for new ideas and new ways of doing things. It will allow the new team to look at a problem with fresh eyes.
Napak is lagging behind in education and the health sector. The power lines all pass above your homes. The electricity tariff being too high
We will reduce that power tariff. It is too high for the citizens especially in the rural areas.
PM visited BMW in Munich, a great example of how working together helps both UK & Germany: https://t.co/o7RRtDEXRT https://t.co/DWiqD3gXvu
One of the keys of success in education is being able to read your books at night. Hence the need for power to aid your efforts in educ
We will have a special program for education including scholarships to reduce on the high rate of school dropouts.
My govt pledges to build Health Centers and to have them adequately staffed by building staff quarters at subcounty level so drs have homes.
I spoke expensively on the advanced subcounty model on radio and I got good responses. Our unit of development is not the district.
Rather we want the subcounty to become productive and create all sorts of opportunities for the citizens living in that sub county.
Finally, I would like to speak of the Karamajong cattle that were stolen. I pledge that my government will restock these cattle.
The livelihood of the people of Karamoja is very much tied to livestock rearing which we must improve while preserving Karamajong culture.
